title: How do Egyptians feel about Hollywood whitewashing Egyptian history? How do they feel about the white Nefertiti bust and white King Tut bust? - Quora

response.answer_text: How do the Egyptians feel about Hollywood whitewashing their culture? How do they feel about the white Nefertiti bust and white King Tut bust? Well I guess it depends on which modern Egyptians you ask. I find it strange to have Nefertiti and King Tut so light when they have pictures in the tombs being reddish brown. Tomb paintings of him show him as a man of color reddish- brown. The results of a CT scan done on King Tutankhamun's mummy indicate the boy king was not murdered, but may have suffered a badly broken leg shortly before his death at age 19 - a wound that could have become infected, Egypt's top archaeologist said on Oct 7, 2018.A CT scan does not tell you the color of a person. Also, some archaeologists will tell you that you can not always tell race from the skull of a Mixed race person.At the exhibit, "Tutankhamun and the Golden Age of the Pharaohs," at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art: On the side of the glass case, there is a disclaimer that reads, "The features of [Tutankhamen's] face are based on scientific data. But the exact color of his skin and the size and shape of many facial details cannot be determined with full certainty."King Tut was a Pharaoh of the New Kingdom. Most of these Kings in this time span would be mixed. However, DNA analysis shows he had majority Sub-Saharan DNA and then Eurasia DNA.DNA testing is the only way to determine the racial origin of ancient people, however all DNA studies from two white companies linked these Ancient Egyptian royal mummies to have mixed DNA however The Egyptian Gene is Sub-Saharan African in origin; The highest % went to DNA of sub-Saharan Africans. If you want to know true Egyptians, take the DNA from Royals…not commoners who could easily been buried anywhere.The Egyptian Gene - DNA Consultants https://dnaconsultants.com/egyptian-gene/ The King Tut Gene - DNA Consultants https://dnaconsultants.com/king-tut-gene/ The Akhenaten Gene - DNA Consultants https://dnaconsultants.com/akhenaten-gene/ Ramses II's mom The Thuya Gene - DNA Consultants https://dnaconsultants.com/thuya-gene/   When ppl say the black kings did not exist first in Egypt, that is like saying the Indian wasn't in America...u rarely see a 100% native Indian in America now, but the fact remains they were. Now-a- days, some modern Egyptians only want to trace their ancestry back to the Arabs.Egypt experienced many conquests, colorizations, and mass immigration across all of its extended history. Its complexion, culture, ethnicity, and borders changed because of this.There were black, white, and mixed Pharaohs during different time spans. That is why it is so important to post dates.The Pharaohs married many Foreign Princesses to bind treaties and had many Bi-racial kids. However, before 1640 BC, Ancient Egypt started first with black Africans who were indigenous tribes to the Nile Valley located in Africa…then Egypt became multicultural...it’s not rocket science; The African Kings existed from the start.Considering the number of foreign slaves that Egypt had captured from wars, the pharaohs marrying foreign princesses to bind treaties, having many Bi-racial kids, plus being a major trading center since the 2rd Dynasty…One has to be reminded of the fact that ancient Egypt was NOT a racially and ethnically Homogenous society even if Africans made up the bulk of the population. You will find paintings and statues of all races in various tombs.Hollywood whitewashes ALL cultures. No one is exempt. I am sure some of the Egyptians feel the same as the American Indian. In many of the old Western movies, white actors played Indians with painted skin tones. Some Egyptians feel the same way as the Asian actors. Hollywood would simply create a white man to look Asian. Remember; Mickey Rooney’s performance of I. Y. Yunioshi in Breakfast at Tiffany's. Thas been the subject of extensive critical commentary and review since its theatrical release. Hollywood would use white actor in blackface for blacks. Blackface - WikipediaAll races have been oppressed at some time in History and all have at one time felt bad about it. You feel unloved and invisible.The media has a lot of influence over our self-esteem. ( If you allow it). Symbolic annihilation, is the idea that if you don’t see people like you in a positive light, in the media you consume, you must somehow be unimportant. It covers race, gender, sexual preference, etc.. The TV show, Will and Grace, was very important because it showed positive gay characters. During its original run Will & Grace was one of the most successful television series with gay principal characters.That is why it is very important to know your history. If you truly wanted to learn the TRUTH, do your own research...Google is your friend. Also, visit a library, open some history books and read information on the subject. You'll have all the access you need to lead you in the right direction.When ppl say the black kings did not exist first in Egypt, that is like saying the Indian wasn't in America...u rarely see a 100% native Indian in America now, but the fact remains they were. How can a people indigenous to the Nile Valley located in Africa be from Middle East? Ancient Egypt, before 1640 BC, was ethnically African, the founders came from the South and extended the Kingdom to the North. The South is referred to the Upper Nile which includes Northern Sudan and Southern Egypt. The truth is ancient Egyptians were Ethnically and indigenously African.When you speak of Egypt you must specify what period of time you are talking about. Are you talking about the Old Kingdom, the Middle kingdom, or the New Kingdom. Why? Because ownership of this land has been passed around from various empires like a football during a Super bowl game.Excerpts from Modern Humans Came Out of Africa, "Definitive" Study Says1. Modern humans (Homo sapiens) have a single origin in Africa. Everyone was black at one time. Africa is the mother of all races. Tribes started to migrate to different parts of the earth. (Tower of Babylon in the Bible) The farther away people lived from Africa, the lighter they became due to genetic mutation. The tribes always settled near rivers of water. Some African tribes settled along the whole length of the Nile. These tribes grew and became settlements. The settlements grew and became villages. The villages grew and became towns, then cities, and then kingdoms.Egypt is in Africa. Egypt (Greek name) is at the top of Africa by the Sudan. Its ancient name was Kermit or Kemet meaning black soil. The Africans were Kings there first before the foreign invaders. Then you have invasions from foreigners such as: the Hyksos 1640 BC - 1532 BC, Assyrians invaded around 671 BC,, the Persians 525 BC, the Greeks in 332 BC, the Romans invaded in 30 BC to make Egypt part of the Roman Empire, then the Arabs came around 600 AD.Archaeology is an important science that confirms the historical accuracy of the Bible. Since the Bible refers to hundreds of cities, kings, and places, we would expect to find evidence from on-site excavations of statues, maps, and scrolls of ancient Egypt. http://www.bible.ca/archeology/bible-archeology.htmThere is a Bust of Pharaoh Huni from 3rd dynasty. Huni - Wikipedia  There is a bust from Sahure from the 5th Dynasty. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sahure  Taharqa - Wikipedia notice the two serpents on his crown. He is King of Cush and King of Egypt.  Taharqa - Wikipedia notice the two serpents on his crown. He is King of Cush and King of Egypt. Bust of Pharaoh Shabaka - Wikipedia 25th Dynasty  Nubians were the elite soldiers of Ancient Egypt. They were called the Medjay. They became part of the Ancient Egyptian military as scouts.The Nubians existed since the Old Kingdom. They were mercenaries first and then progressed to be military scouts They made a BIG IMPACT!!!The Medjay were an elite paramilitary police force"We have come to serve Pharaoh": A study of the Medjay and Pangrave as an ethnic group and as mercenaries from c. 2300 BCE until c. 1050BCEThis places the Medjay in the Old kingdom. ( 2686–2181 BC)The Medjay worked in all parts of Egyptian society, as palace attendants, temple employees, merchants, soldiers and more.The Medjay worked in Egyptian fortifications in Nubia and patrolled the desert along with other Egyptian soldiers, like the Akhwty.The Egyptian army during the Second Intermediate Period was largely made up of Medjay, Nubian warriors who fought as mercenaries. Medjay served as scouts, light infantry, and finally as cavalry units. https://www.ancient.eu/Egyptian_...They also were sometimes employed as soldiers (as we know from the stele of Res and Ptahwer). And during the Second Intermediate Period, they were even used during Kamose's campaign against the Hyksos.The Medjay became instrumental in making the Egyptian state into a military power. That means they made a big impact. Medjay - WikipediaNubia called the Land of the bow. “Land of the Bow” is the meaning of Ta-Seti, an ancient Egyptian term used to denote Nubia for thousands of years in antiquity. They were expert Archers.Relations between Egypt and Nubia, show peaceful cultural interchange and cooperation, including mixed marriages.Depictions of Nubians in the Tomb of Amenhotep Huy, in Egypt, show they ranged in skin color. Some of them have the reddish-brown complexions, while others are darker.See below. Nubians Were Pharaohs and Queens (Including but not just limited to 25th Dynasty). This is proven by the tomb drawings from Mentuhotep II temple complex.Nebhepetre Mentuhotep II (reigned c. 2061 BC – 2010 BC) was a Pharaoh of the 11th Dynasty who reigned for 51 years. Around his 39th year on the throne he reunited Egypt, thus ending the First Intermediate Period. Consequently, he is considered the first pharaoh of the Middle Kingdom. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mentuhotep_II  Painting is from the inside of Queen Aashyt chamber in Mentuhotep II temple. Even back in Biblical times, the descendants of the 3 sons of Noah, intermingled with each other. Plus, the Kings and Pharaohs would have many wives and concubines. Some of the wives would come from foreign royalty in foreign lands, to bind treaties of the powerful nations at that time. So their offspring would be Bi-racial.Example: 1 Kings 1–4 states: The Hebrew and Christian Bible tells us that the Jewish King Solomon had 700 wives and 300 concubines. The wives were described as foreign princesses, including Pharaoh's daughter and women of Moab, Ammon, Edom, Sidon and of the Hittites.In the Quran, Solomon is considered a major prophet, and Muslimsgenerally refer to him by the Arabic variant Sulayman, son of David.Genesis 41 :45 Pharaoh gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-Paneah and gave him Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, to be his wife. And Joseph went throughout the land of Egypt.Race was not much of a factor, but class or status was important. The Egyptians also elevated some human beings to gods. Their leaders, called pharaohs, were believed to be gods in human form.So, there was much race mixing even in biblical times. Egypt was a major trading center. Ordinary people also mingled together. Also, since the Middle Kingdom, foreign slaves mainly from Asia, became increasingly numerous. They were either prisoners of war or traded by slave merchants. See Slavery, its causes and practiceTherefore, you begin to see many shades of Colored People from the darkest eggplant hue to honey-colored caramel, to brownish- tan, to reddish brown (ruddy colored), etc.For example: Pharaoh Amenhotep III is known to have married several foreign princesses as part of treaties which balanced power between nations. Notice how many foreign princess he had. This is a good indicator of a Nation’s power. During this time frame, Egypt was a major force to be reckon with. Egypt did not give too many of their princesses away.Amenhotep III: Biography, Family & Death | Study.com: Biography, Sons & Family Tree | Study.com Amenhotep III • Gilukhepa, the daughter of Shuttarna II of Mitanni, in the tenth year of his reign. • Tadukhepa, the daughter of his ally Tushratta of Mitanni, Around Year 36 of his reign • A daughter of Kurigalzu, king of Babylon. • A daughter of Kadashman-Enlil, king of Babylon. • A daughter of Tarhundaradu, ruler of Arzawa. • A daughter of the ruler of Ammia (in modern Syria).The Bible said Egypt is the Land of Ham. The Bible refers to Egypt as "the land of Ham" in Psalms 78:51; 105:23,27 ; 106:22; 1 Chronicles 4:40. The Bible never mentions once the lands of either England or Germany. However, African nations are mentioned again and again.It has over forty references to Ethiopia and over one hundred references to Egypt. Even ancient sources, biblical and non-biblical, mention both Ethiopia and Egypt together long before either country was on any map. Egypt's ancient name was Kermit or Kemet meaning black soil. It talks about the wars that involved the major superpowers since mankind started. These wars can be proven to be true from History books and archaeological finds.Psalm 105:23-27 (KJV) 23 Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham. 24 And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies. 25 He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtly with his servants. 26 He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen. 27 They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham. Psalm 106:20-22 20They exchanged their glorious God for an image of a bull, which eats grass. 21They forgot the God who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt, miracles in the land of Ham and awesome deeds by the Red Sea. The Egyptologist Darrell Baker states that the 14th dynasty being of Canaanite origin. Canaan was the brother to Mizriam (Egypt) and to Cush( Ethiopia), and Put. These brothers helped each other fight the western invaders. A. Amarna Tablets are a collection of 382 clay tablets written by the Canaanites to Pharaoh of Egypt, asking his brother for help....Help me Brother, oh great Egypt ......I need help. I am getting attacked!!!!the letters include requests for military help in the north against Hittite invaders, and in the south to fight against the Habiru (Hebrew). Yes, Canaan needed help in defending themselves from the invading Israelite's under Joshua. At the time of the Conquest of Canaan by Israel (Joshua) Egypt was nominally in control of the region. go to: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amarna_letters#/media/File:Amarnamap.png and go to: http://www.bible.ca/archeology/bible-archeology-maps-conquest-amarna-tablets-letters-akhenaten-habiru-abiru-hebrews-1404-1340bc.htm B. The Bible has historical events that have been proven to be true: The brothers helped each other fight as describe in Jerimiah and other chapters - Jeremiah 46:9 Charge, you horses! Drive furiously, you charioteers! March on, you warriors-men of Cush and Put who carry shields, men of Lydia who draw the bow. (They march out of Egypt, arranged in their divisions; cavalry, chariots, and infantry to begin the campaign.) The forty-sixth chapter contains two prophecies concerning it: one was the discomfiture of Pharaoh Necho at Carchemish by Nebuchadnezzar. Nahum 3:9 Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, and it was infinite; Put and Lubim were thy helpers. Ezekiel 25-32 consists of prophecies against nations. Ezekiel 30:5 states: Ethiopia, and Libya, and Lydia — (The names in Hebrew are Cush, Phut, and Lud, which are mentioned together as the Egyptian allies), and the people of the covenant land will fall by the sword along with Egypt. The Egyptians, employed mercenary soldiers from their brother’s tribes.  Ethiopians—Hebrew name is Cush:  Libyans--Phut, Mauritania, west of Egypt (compare Genesis 10:6 ). The Libyans used long shields extending to the feet. Lydians sometimes called Ludim ( Genesis 10:13 , 1 Chronicles 1:11 , Nahum 3:9 Isaiah 66:19 ; Jeremiah 46:9 ; Ezekiel 27:10 ; Ezekiel 30:5 and 38:5 ) Ludim --, an African nation descended from Egypt (Mizraim);Mizraite people or tribe descended from Ludim the son of Mizraim; also called Lydians. It is probable that the Ludim were settled to the west of Egypt, perhaps farther than any other Mizraite tribe. Lud and the Ludim are mentioned in four passages of the prophets. Many of the Pharaohs that are mentioned in the Bible can be found in the writings of the historians Herodotus. Josephus Flavius, and Manetho. Manetho wrote the "Aegyptiaca" (History of Egypt) in which he divided the rulers into dynasties (or ruling houses) which forms the basis of the modern system of dating Ancient Egypt. Diodorus of Sicily writes: {quote} The Ethiopians say that the Egyptians are one of their colonies which was brought into Egypt by Osiris. They even allege that this country was originally under water, but that the Nile, dragging much mud as it flowed from Ethiopia, had finally filled it in and made it a part of the continent. ... They add that from them, as from their authors and ancestors, the Egyptians get most of their laws. It is from them that the Egyptians have learned to honor﻿ Quote from Lucian (Greek writer) when describing an Egyptian:"This boy is not merely black; he has thick lips and his legs are too thin..." How do they feel? The average Egyptian citizen? The one's I've spoken to especially the young ones have no idea about their own ancient history. Is this Hollywood's responsibility? First of all the whole history is distorted. The black people fight over those mummies and the white people too. They even had a horror movie that an Algerian Actress played the lead role of the Mummy. So the black people were mad and complaining about the actress being a white actress. Saying it's a lie they are using a white actress to play the role. First of all it was quite accurate. The actress is North African Algerian. Egypt is in North Africa and the Egyptians even built pyramids in Algeria. Does anyone know this? Not even Algerians know about their own countries heritage. Because this is my own ancient history which is an African lineage I’m studying it now From 20 thousand years ago my DNA test that I gave my father states we were the indigenous people of Morocco the Amazigh tribe. This tribe also has Egyptian heritage. The majority of Algerians most likely have Egyptian heritage. Before this I came from Ethiopia and Mali. So the Egyptian ancient history is distorted. We had different dynasty with different ethnic backgrounds throughout. One of the most important Dynasty was when the Kemet people ruled. This is where we get the 42 principles of Maat. They were a Sub Saharan people that ruled this dynasty. Everytime they want to scare people about the Illuminati and the ancient Egyptian symbols and meanings it actually comes from these principles that the world has no idea about. The major religions throughout the world come from these Principles. Why we even had religion after this I don't understand because it is basically redundant. I would not blame everything on Hollywood, I would blame every individual who does not take the time to learn the truth and see that yes history has been distorted and it continues to be distorted in terms of other people completely being left out of history. If we want to know the truth than we must seek it ourselves.

The whitewashing of Egyptian history was made by outsiders, that is, by Eurocentrists who claim that ancient Egyptians were white people. According to Eurocentrists, Nefertiti was a white woman and King Tut was a white man. Egyptians are mad at Afrocentrists because they lay false claim on their unique, long lasting and brilliant history by asserting that ancient Egyptians viewed or thought of themselves as black people. According to Afrocentrists, Nerfertiti wiewed or thought of herself as a black woman. In addition, King Tut viewed or thought of himself as a black man. Afrocentrism is just like Eurocentrism; it is a pseudoscience. Color coded races (white race, black race, red race, yellow race) are pure products of European imperialism and colonialism. They are socio-cultural constructs and part of the racialist paradigm, which places the white race at the top and the black race at the bottom. Afrocentrists are mad because the black and white divide makes no sense in Egyptian society and throughout all of Egyptian history. It only makes perfect sense in the US where identities are tangled in color coded races.  Someone said that there are no such people as “The White people.” People of pale skin don’t share a common ancestry, history, language, heritage, tradition, culture or homeland. He was right 100%. A pale Nuristani man from Aghanistan with blue eye and blond hair is not considered a white man whereas a dark skinned and wavy haired Welsh man is a white man because all ethnic Europeans white people. North Africans, including Egyptians, perfectly know that they are not white people because they are not ethnic Europeans. The vast majority of them are not black either as someone rightly said that Northern Africa is the great border zone where white ends meeting the area where black begins.

The far Islamic right objects to all ‘graven images’, especially pagan gods. The Taliban destroyed many of the wonderful artwork in their country. Some have threatened terror attacks against the pyramids. However, most of the people in Egypt are not Moslem fanatics. Most Moslems, even religious ones, recognize the pagan gods as fictions. They no more object to ancient Egypt culture than a serious Christian objects to Grimm’s fairy tales. Further, Egyptian culture is a source of money and recognition for Egypt. Egyptians may object to the Afro-centric view of history. They don’t see themselves as descendants of Africans, per se. They see themselves as Arabs, the descendants of Ishmael. If Ishmael was black, so was Isaac and Abraham. Anyone else that snuck into the lineage are welcome as converts. Maybe there is resentment about A religious Moslem may not even care if some of his ancestors were black, any more than a religious Jew would object to a distant ancestor as black. None of the people in ancient Egypt have made it as Moslem prophets. So they are not likely to object to white actors playing ancient Egyptian roles. However, the Jewish slant may upset them. They may also take except to colonial propaganda. They may side with black people as being oppressed allies. ‘The enemy of my enemy is my friend.’ That is an old proverb that is commonly attributed to the Arab culture. So some Egyptians may feel a kinship with some black ‘liberation’ groups just because they are fighting colonial and neocolonial society. However, biological kinship is not a factor here. Some Egyptians may feel kinship with the Islamic people that fought the Crusaders, or European colonialism. They may be in denial as to the role Arabs played in advancing slavery. However, the medieval Arabs enslaved both white and black. They enslaved their own people. Arabs were equal opportunity slavers. It is only in the West where the issue of color became so important. Allah is on the side of whoever wins. The Nazis sold some racist propaganda. That is the origin of some anti-zionism. It worked to some extent because they both saw themselves as fighting Jews. However, surely the Anti-zionists did not think of themselves as Aryans. I don’t think biological kinship is a factor anymore with anybody, anymore. Genome sequencing has shown how much event the ‘purest’ peoples really are. No one who is sane really is going to trace his ancestors back to ancient times. Most Egyptians are sane. They are who they are right now. They are their own cultural entity. This black versus white thing is a European invention. Yes, this black versus white thing is Western insanity. The Arabs and Egyptians have enough insanity of their own. However, they are not about to raise a ruckus just because the actors don’t look Black.

You have to forgive me, but I can’t help thinking that the formulation of this question sounds a little like a reflection of a weird preoccupation with natural skin colour that is exclusively American. It’s almost as though when people have a darker skin tone that they are somehow inferior, which is of course completely fatuous. A pink skin tone makes it possible to make vitamin D under a weak sun, and your ancestors many millennia ago had to evolve adaptations as they moved further out of Africa, involving the reduction of melanin in their skin to resolve their inadequacy. They didn’t need so much since it is there to protect them against sunburn. The higher the latitude the paler skin becomes. When I see the bust of Nefertiti I see a lady with a brown skin, probably half-way between pink and dark brown (black?) which is appropriate geographically, and when I see the face of King Tut it is actually made of gold, which might look dark in some lights and whiter in others. I don’t suppose that Egyptians give a wallaby’s w**k about how pink Hollywood makes them, since they would also see it also presenting Moses and Jesus as pink (sorry, I mean ‘white’) when obviously they would have been black or well on the way to being so. The most you could do is give them a giggle and stir them to hum a line of ‘God bless America’.

I really don't get this liberal fascination with race. I get it that supremacists are race-conscious but why are progressives trying to recreate a racially-segregated world where racial identity is getting more and more pronounced by the passage of each day. Just think about it, maybe this sensitivity is helping establish another form of subtle segregation if not all-out apartheid. If we started scrutinizing everything, it is imperative that we will be stuck in a kind of obsessive vicious cycle. For instance, if Nefirtiti is played by a black woman in a Hollywood movie, first of all the racist half of America and Europe might not watch it and thus sink a let's say 300 million dollar movie and even then Egyptians of Coptic descent might object to that too. Then you will have to look for a coptic Egyptian with no Arabic blood who also knew acting and so the story continues. I am not against artistic perfectionism but this snow-flake attitude of finding flaws in movies is ridiculous and indirectly racist. By this standard, JFK should always be played by an Irish-American, Mahmatma Gandhi by a Banya Gujarati and Trump oh Trump, Germans have little sense of humour, so I guess we are stuck with Bill Maher’s famous Orangutan.

I suspect that Egyptians don’t care much what Hollywood does. If a specifically American (Hollywood) studio is going to make a big budget film about ancient Egypt, they are not going to put unknown actors in leading roles. To do so will reduce their chances of a return on the large investment. While Egypt has produced fine artists in several genres, they are virtually unknown outside the Arabic speaking world. And there is a huge amount of anti Muslim sentiment in the USA right now (just look at the questions on here) so any leading actor who appears to be Muslim will guarantee a small audience. It could even stir violence from hateriots. Urban Dictionary: Hateriot Further, the claim that all ancient Egyptians were black is flat out false (they were not “white” either) and the idea that Arabic invaders completely replaced the population is utter bollocks. The Anglo-Saxons, Vikings and Normans combined did not do it in the UK where the majority of the population are still mostly descended from the people who arrived 10,000 or more years ago. It was even less likely when the Arabs invaded Egypt which has had million strong populations since pharonic times. There is no point in whinging about movies like Cleopatra with Ms E Taylor which is nearly 55 years old. It was almost a flop and and is nearly forgotten now. The past is a foreign country, they do things differently there.

Hi, Joseph Egyptians don't care about how pharaohs looked like thousands years ago. I'll not add more about busts, Dr. Ernest Adam said it all in his answer. Yes you can find it nowadays in every shape and material. Did you watch the movie "Cleopatra" ? If so you can compare between her original pictures and Elizabeth Taylor.   Ancient Egyptians are known to be brown skinned varying from light to dark as you go to the south, however Egypt is an open country and the race has been mixed with many ethnicities from Turks to Europe. I assure you how Egyptians look in Hollywood movies is not an issue. The issue is something else, at least for me. When I watch a movie like "independence day" and in the ending of the movie there are some people dressing weird customes belong to the 17th century and running happily and ignorantly towards the pyramids to celebrate destroying the aliens starship by American air force or whatever.. This is the brainwashing against us, and this is what I personally hate.    Thank you for A2A

Maybe I only really care because this concerns me as someone raised outside of Egypt, but it’s annoying. There’s lots of uncertainty surrounding the skin tone/race of the Ancient Egyptians, but regardless of that, neither Ancient nor Modern Egyptians were/are white. Whitewashing is extremely annoying because it’s so unnecessary. You can easily find actors of the right race to play your characters, although I suppose in the past the movie would have been a flop like that. I hate saying it, but I understand why they whitewashed our history. They just need to make an effort to stop. In terms of whitewashing busts, a lot of the other answers have made their points about this already, but busts are just art. They can be any colour, so I don’t feel like those are whitewashed. Unless you’re referring to other busts that just show the skin tone in a different colour and everything else the original, that’s offensive. We have no way of knowing for sure what the races/skin tones of our ancestors were, though.

Ernest gave a great answer. Also, if the movie doesn’t have a lot of big Hollywood names (most of which are white), not a lot of people are going to go see it (I think it’s kind of ridiculous that people will only watch films if they have big names, but that’s the case). I remember when Exodus: Gods and Kings was criticized for being whitewashed. Ridley Scott made a great point when he said, "I can't mount a film of this budget...and say that my lead actor is Mohammad so-and-so from such-and-such...I'm just not going to get financed." There are a lot of Egyptian films on ancient Egypt. You can always watch those with subtitles if you don’t understand Arabic. Check out the Egyptian film “Al Kenz”. It’s a very well made movie.

Egypt is a transition between those who are called “brown people”, like Arabs and “black people” of Sudan, if we follow the Nile, so you can expect anything between these ranges, including those who took power in Egypt. In recent history Gamal Abdel Nasser would be a brown person, he is from a region that used to be Lower Egypt, Anwar Sadat would be black, as he is from a family from what what would be the Upper Egypt. But in any region, you can find people from all spectrum. Nerfetiti and Tutankhamun belonged to the end of the 18th dynasty, which had strong alliances with the Mittani, who were Indo Iranian people that lived in the Levant area. Very few white people, as it is characterized in USA and UKA, knew how to use copper by the time of the great pyramids until that of Tutankhamun. Those who knew were in the regions that mined metals that ended in the empires of middle east.

Funny, I have a soapstone bust of Nefertiti that I bought in Egypt when I was about 15. It’s looking at me now, 30 years down the line. It’s probably closest to the second picture of Ernest W. Adams’ answer. That thing has been hauled from pillar to post, from my crazystudent days to icky separation from partner. But until I saw this question, I never thought of it as black/white/yellow/blue/purple. And I still can’t. Deferring to the wonderful Ernest W. Adams again, I think the pictures illustrate how black (or not) Nef was. So, there hasnae been any whitewashing, and ultimately it’s all down to your perception. Besides, everyone knows Tutankhamun wasn’t black or white. Blue and gold man, blue and gold….!!!  Not a bad look for a clubfooted pharaoh!!

This is the original bust of Nefertiti. It was made out of limestone, then coated with stucco and painted. It’s the original paint. She is depicted as light brown, which is appropriate for Egypt, although women were routinely depicted as lighter than men were.  Egyptians sell a bazillion busts of Nefertiti in shops all over Egypt. They’re mostly carved out of alabaster or soapstone. This kind of thing is pretty typical: Alabaster Nefertiti  But they can be made out of all kinds of things in all kinds of colors: White Nefertiti  Black Nefertiti  Bottom line: Egyptians are really, really not as obsessed with the race of their ancient forebears as Americans seem to be.

Ancient Egyptians were much whiter than most modern Africans, especially those that live south of the Sahara. Ramses II had red hair, for heaven’s sake. There’s probably some element of whitewashing going on, sure, but it’s nowhere near as extreme as people think it is (for Egyptians. Hollywood has a major race problem that I’m not trying to deny or minimize). The white busts probably have much more to do with the fact that Egypt lacks much in the way of basalt or magnetite, but has a surplus of limestone (courtesy of the time it spent as ocean floor during the Mesozoic and the Tertiary) than it does with race. It’s also true that classical statues were often painted, and white stone lends itself to this better than black stone.

I’m not sure what you mean, “whitewashing.” Have you ever met an actual Egyptian? I have. I work with a couple of totally awesome Egyptian guys and I have to tell you, they are not really really dark. See this guy? Maybe you’ve seen Mister Robot, or Night at the Museum, or his Oscar-winning turn in Bohemian Rhapsody, this is Rami Malek, Egyptian  Or how about Mister Robot’s Egyptian creator/writer/producer/director, Sam Esmail?  They more or less resemble the Egyptians I know from work and have met around town.
They don’t see there as being any such thing. Unlike some Americans, they’re comfortable with the idea that their ancestors looked pretty much like them.
